image.altText: A mountain next to a lake

props.synopsis: Two bushwalkers with mild hypothermia are being walked out of Cradle Mountain National Park in Tasmania's central highlands after activating their emergency beacon last night.

title.children: Rescue underway for Cradle Mountain bushwalkers with hypothermia

image.altText: An artist impression of a proposed hospital.

props.synopsis: A plan that will enable a state-of-the-art medical facility with 10 operating theatres, a laboratory, pharmacy, helipad and a bridge to Launceston's public hospital is unanimously supported by all Launceston councillors in a vote.

title.children: New Launceston private hospital a step closer after unanimous council vote

image.altText: a firefighter in foreground with active bushfire in the mid-ground

props.synopsis: A COVID outbreak that "spread quickly" through a cramped fire management headquarters was just one issue faced during the response to Tasmania's west coast fires last summer, a review finds.

title.children: Fatigue, cramped HQ and COVID hampered west coast fire effort, review finds

image.altText: A woman in glasses and a hair net works in a kitchen cutting potatoes.

props.synopsis: For some Australians, continuing to work until the pension age of 67 can be a struggle. Peita says a life of heavy lifting has taken its toll on her body, and she is trying to survive on JobSeeker payments.

title.children: Calls to lower retirement age as manual labourers stretch pensions

image.altText: A large brown coloured factory positioned on a river with the view of a mountain behind it.

props.synopsis: Hobart suburbs bordering a zinc smelter and a mining town in north-west Tasmania will undergo human health risk monitoring for lead deposit rates, the state's environment protection watchdog has announced.

title.children: 'Extensive' lead monitoring to begin in Hobart residential areas near industrial sites

image.altText: A four storey brown brick building sits on a city corner block

props.synopsis: Some TasTAFE course fees are set to rise from a few hundred dollars to up to $21,000 due to subsidies being removed, and the minister responsible says it is because TAFE needs to deliver key vocational skills.

title.children: Subsidy changes to some TasTAFE courses will price students out, union says

image.altText: A young woman holding binoculars in the jungle.

props.synopsis: British primatologist Jane Goodall entered the African wilderness at 26 years old without any formal scientific training or university degree. She emerged with research that forever changed how we understood the animal kingdom.

title.children: Jane Goodall watched a chimp hunt for termites. It was a sign humans are not alone

image.altText: A man wearing police uniform and armour and holding a rifle, sitting in a car

props.synopsis: The US president's peace plan for Gaza includes the creation of a temporary "International Stabilisation Force", but analysts say this will be a challenging task.

title.children: The missing detail in Trump's peace plan that could mean 'violence will persist'

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk holding a black folder open with yellow-gold curtains and two flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Since returning to the White House, the US president has placed tariffs on more than 90 countries and a number of industries. Here are the countries and sectors most impacted by the tariffs from the Trump administration.

title.children: The industries hit hardest by Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs

image.altText: Images of 'old man' face used to bypass social media age bans.

props.synopsis: From December 10, social media platforms will be forced to block under 16s in Australia from holding accounts, but experts warn age checks can be easily bypassed in several ways, including a $22 "old man" mask.

title.children: VPNs, 'old man' masks, and AI: The tech war quietly raging behind the social media ban

image.altText: Chris Minns New South Wales Premier

props.synopsis: State and territory leaders are lining up to criticise the federal government over its public hospital funding offer, accusing it of not fulfilling a 2023 promise. Follow live.

title.children: Premiers fire up in stoush over health funding

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Feds 'can't have it both ways' on health funding: Minns
'You've got to do more': Qld premier fires back at feds over health funding
How would nuclear energy fit into Australia’s power grid?

image.altText: A hand-drawn map of Australia showing surrounding ocean heat in red, orange and yellow with a temperature scale

props.synopsis: For the past year, Australia's oceans have been hotter than ever before. The impacts are being felt all across the nation — as far away from the coast as you can get.

title.children: Ocean heat was off the charts, and Australia bore the brunt

image.altText: a group of people walk in rugged bushland, they wear orange uniform and police uniform

props.synopsis: Almost 50 members of the Australian Defence Force will join the search for missing boy Gus, which is entering its sixth day in outback South Australia, police have confirmed.

title.children: ADF joins search for missing 4yo but no further 'traces of any footprints'

image.altText: Professor Adrian Baddeley speaks out about Murujuga Rock Art monitoring in Karratha

props.synopsis: A scientist who quit a major study on WA rock art is accusing the government of downplaying findings linking damage to heavy industry.

title.children: Top statistician accuses government of spinning rock art science

image.altText: River runs through tree area

props.synopsis: A major developer wants to build 500 apartments on the banks of a river to Brisbane's south, but some concerned residents say the flooding risk is too high.

title.children: Hundreds of units proposed on land that faces 'extreme potential flood levels'

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX has jumped more than 1 per cent after solid gains on Wall Street overnight. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX makes strong gains led by miners and bank

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's trade surplus narrows as gold exports dry up
ASX 200 up 1.2% heading into afternoon session
Australia "well positioned" to navigate global uncertainty: RBA

image.altText: A man sitting outside.

props.synopsis: Luke Filby remembers looking up to his uncle Dezi, right up until the point he didn't. And he's not alone in having stepped away before the killing of two police officers.

title.children: 'Extreme and fanatical': Those who knew Dezi Freeman speak on why they stayed away

image.altText: A composite image of a young blonde woman and two middle-aged men.

props.synopsis: We asked Australia's favourite authors to share their top books of the 21st century. Here's what they said.

title.children: Australia's favourite authors share their top books of the 21st century

image.altText: A unwell looking man with an oxygen tube in his nose and a bandaged elbow lies in a bed.

props.synopsis: A groundsman who tripped over a bag of rubbish as he tried to evade a wasp says he wants workers to understand their rights.

title.children: Employee injured after wasp startled him has $870k damages win upheld

image.altText: A double-storey white church building sits behind a green fence.

props.synopsis: Multiple investigations are examining a Victorian church's response to an assault committed by a senior pastor's son, amid allegations that information was withheld from the church community.

title.children: Church under investigation after pastor's son sexually assaulted teen

image.altText: ATO Melbourne office, logo on the wall.

props.synopsis: The proportion of large companies in Australia that paid no tax in the most recent income year has declined from 36 per cent to 28 per cent over the past 11 years.

title.children: For the first time in 11 years, less than 30 per cent of big companies paid no tax

image.altText: Rheed McCracken looks across at his competitors before a World Para Athletics wheelchair race.

props.synopsis: Rheed McCracken wins his second silver of the world championships despite the world record holder's disqualification, while Briseis Brittain begins her quest to emulate the great Cathy Freeman.

title.children: McCracken wins silver as Arnhem teen starts quest to be 'just like Cathy'

image.altText: An 80-year-old woman with short grey hair and a navy top, standing with her arms crossed, a green monstera in the foreground

props.synopsis: This year, Helen Garner has been in Dua Lipa's book club and the SATC spin-off. Now she's in the running for the Baillie Gifford Prize for non-fiction.

title.children: Helen Garner's 'candid, pacey' diaries up for $100k international prize

image.altText: James Tedesco stands in front of the Sydney skyline.

props.synopsis: Roosters fullback James Tedesco held off the challenge of players over a decade his junior to defy time and claim his second Dally M player of the year award.

title.children: How Tedesco marched to a staggering and deserved Dally M glory

image.altText: A couple sitting at a table looking away from each other

props.synopsis: Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban are separating after 19 years of marriage. Separation is common — and here’s what experts say those of us living outside the public eye can expect when going through it.

title.children: What couples can expect when separating after a long relationship

image.altText: A designed image showing a man and a woman in front of a building marked Princeton Consumer Research.

props.synopsis: Two former employees of a leading international testing laboratory used by major Australian sunscreen brands have blown the whistle on alleged questionable data and incorrect testing practices, amid ongoing concerns about whether consumers can trust the products they are relying on for sun protection.

title.children: Whistleblowers allege questionable practices at sunscreen testing lab

image.altText: Phil Gould speaks to the media outside Canterbury Bulldogs NRL training.

props.synopsis: The Canterbury Bulldogs boss assures fans he is on the mend after being hospitalised when doctors found a problem during routine blood tests.

title.children: Phil Gould hospitalised but says 'everything is OK'

image.altText: a big oil tanker sits in the ocean off the french coast

props.synopsis: President Emmanuel Macron says France is probing the ship for "serious offences".

title.children: French navy boards Russian shadow fleet ship, arrests two crew members

image.altText: A woman looks at a phone she is holding while covering her face and crying

props.synopsis: Authorities say those rescued alive were able to communicate with rescuers, with another three people killed in the disaster also pulled from the rubble.

title.children: Racing against time': Parents urge rescuers to speed up recovery efforts at collapsed school

image.altText: woman with long black hair and pink skirt walks through a row of trees.

props.synopsis: Modern technology is allowing girls to choose their own partners but some remain vulnerable to child marriage to escape hardship.

title.children: 'The destination is tragically familiar': Social media enabling child marriages

image.altText: A man holds a mobile phone while on a video call at night

props.synopsis: The 48-hour outage was ordered by Taliban authorities but they have not yet commented on the restoration of services.

title.children: Taliban tight-lipped after internet services restored in Afghanistan

image.altText: A young Palestinian girl sitting in the bombed out remains of a school.

props.synopsis: Witnesses reported heavy bombardment in Gaza City, as Israel's defence minister, Israel Katz, said the army was tightening its encirclement of the city.

title.children: Israel steps up Gaza City offensive as Hamas weighs up ceasefire

image.altText: A smiling schoolgirl with braided hair bunches her prosthetic hand into a fist while standing in a classroom.

props.synopsis: Lois Agnello was born with only part of her left hand and came up with the idea to use her school's 3D printer to make a new one.

title.children: Teenager uses school's 3D printer to make herself a new hand

image.altText: Iesha Murphy with butterfly tattoo and black t-shirt

props.synopsis: The family of an Indigenous man who died in prison says an apology from Corrective Services NSW has come "too little, too late".

title.children: Family of man who died in custody says he was treated 'like a dog'

image.altText: A black and white photo of a young boys farewelling a group of adults.

props.synopsis: Men sent to Victoria's Dhurringile mansion and farm from the British care system as children form a friendship lasting six decades.

title.children: Child migrants sent to live at Dhurringile mansion reflect on their lives
